values:
I forgot my password again. Then the website blocked me from logging on... I'm not really a fan of this LJ thing... I am hopeless when it comes to keeping this stuff straight... 
Sigh...

Ummmm... I sort of forgot my password, and I have been very busy with the faire season just around the corner. This is the first time in a while that school hasn't gotten in the way of my writing. Speaking of writing, except for school papers (bleh...) not much writing going on in this section of paradise. We are steadily packing our lives into crates and boxes to be moved to our new address. We take possession on the 15th of June. We are hoping to be totally packed before then. Unlikely, but everyone has to have some hope. :) My problem is everytime I pack something, a day or two later I need it again. That's the story of my life- with finals just around the corner, and faire sneaking in, I have no real chance of actually packing anything until the night before we move. :) 

Anyways, that's the update. Panic and general disorder...

These are the new additions to the ever growing collection of gaming books... 
I am so happy to be able to locate this stuff again. I thought I had lost everything in the fire. Then when they quit printing the old world of darkness stuff I freaked out.
But... Here's the list:

Book of the Wyrm
Werewolf Storyteller's Handbook
Outcastes: a Players guide to Pariahs (Werewolf Sourcebook)
Werewolf Tribebook: Children of Gaia
Vampire Storyteller's Companion
Kinfolk: Unsung Heroes (Werewolf Sourcebook)
Havens of the Damned
Werewolf Tribebook: Shadow Lords

I think that I have a new hobby. Hunting down these books is fun... I have a wish list that is as long as I am tall.

The first part of my order from Amazon.com arrived this morning.
I have ordered like... 15 books from them... Some Rennie stuff... Some RPG stuff that I haven't been able to locate anywhere else... That and I love paying ony $0.65 for a $20 book... NEW. :) 
Changeling the Dreaming came in today... The Player's guide should be arriving Friday or Saturday...
Then just a week or two later... the goodies really begin to arrive. (Yay for free shipping.) 
I bought 
Tudor Tailor
Tudor and Elizabethan Fashions (History of Fashion)
Full-Color Sourcebook of French Fashion: 15th to 19th Centuries 
Tudor Costume and Fashion
Vampire The Masquerade Redemption
World of Darkness: Sorcerer: The Hedge Wizard's Handbook 
Sex with the Queen:
An Elizabethan song book: lute songs, madrigals, and rounds
Werewolf Storytellers Companion
Savoring the Past: The French Kitchen and Table from 1300 to 1789 
Werewolf Players Guide (Werewolf - the Apocalypse)
Book of Storyteller Secrets,Storytellers Screen (Changeling - the Dreaming)
From Renaissance Monarchy to Absolute Monarchy: French Kings, Nobles, and...


Yea... needless to say I spent more money on shipping than I did on the books- But still well under what I would pay at a bookstore. I am doing the happy dance over here... I spent less than $100 on all of it... YAY!!!

Brrr....
That's my imput :) I don't know about everyone else but I am not too eager to go to school and work in the morning... Then again- maybe we'll be lucky and the wind will blow Valvoline down. lol. 

My house is being cleaned as well. We just bought new furniture stuff for the livingroom and soooo... No sense putting nice furniture into a dirty house and all that good stuff. 

I can't wait to give mom her present this year! I bought her a glider rocker (she's wanted one for almost 20 years) It's a very nice one- leather and a footrest that glides as well. And to top it all off.... It even MATCHES our new furniture. (It's a difficult thing to do with our living room- it's done in oranges and reds. Our couches are terra cotta... lol)
Me very excited.
As for dad- well he never ever gives me a hint as to what he wants- I'll have to get mom to help me plot against him. (Evil cackle) 

I was thinking about having some sort of pre-Yule get together. I am not sure about how well it would be recieved though- I was thinking about inviting the girls from Thursday classes and such- but it's a pretty long drive for most of them... Imput anyone?

You are The Lovers

Motive, power, and action, arising from Inspiration and Impulse.

The Lovers represents intuition and inspiration. Very often a choice needs to be made.

Originally, this card was called just LOVE. And that's actually more apt than "Lovers." Love follows in this sequence of growth and maturity. And, coming after the Emperor, who is about control, it is a radical change in perspective. LOVE is a force that makes you choose and decide for reasons you often can't understand; it makes you surrender control to a higher power. And that is what this card is all about. Finding something or someone who is so much a part of yourself, so perfectly attuned to you and you to them, that you cannot, dare not resist. This card indicates that the you have or will come across a person, career, challenge or thing that you will fall in love with. You will know instinctively that you must have this, even if it means diverging from your chosen path. No matter the difficulties, without it you will never be complete.

I recieved this joke through the email and thought it was hilarious...

"My flight was being served by an obviously gay flight  attendant, who
 seemed to put everyone in a good mood  as he served us food and drinks.
 
  As the plane prepared to descend, he came swishing  down the aisle and
 told us that "Captain Marvey has
  asked me to announce that he'll be landing the big  scary plane
 shortly, so lovely people, if you could  just put your trays up, that
 would be super."
 
  On his trip back up the aisle, he noticed this  well-dressed and 
  rather
 Arabic looking woman hadn't
  moved a muscle. "Perhaps you didn't hear me over those  big brute
 engines but I asked you to raise your
  trazy-poo,  so the main man can pitty-pat us on the ground."
 
  She calmly turned her head and said, "In my country, I  am called a
 Princess and I take orders from no one."
 
  To which (I swear) the flight attendant replied, without missing a
 beat, "Well, sweet- cheeks, in my
  country I'm called a Queen, so I outrank you. Tray-up, Bitch."

-
In 1986 (the year you were born)
Ronald Reagan is president of the US

The US officially observes Martin Luther King Day as a national holiday for the first time

The space shuttle Challenger explodes moments after lift off, killing 6 astronauts and a teacher

A major nuclear disaster occurs at the Chernobyl nuclear power plant in the Soviet Union

Japanese video game maker Nintendo introduces its games to America

US warplanes bomb Libyan headquarters in retaliation for terrorist attacks

The Soviet Union launches the Mir space station

IBM unveils the PC Convertible, the first laptop computer

Charlotte Church, The Olsen twins, and Lindsay Lohan are born

New York Mets win the World Series

Chicago Bears win Superbowl XX

Montreal Canadiens win the Stanley Cup

Top Gun is the top grossing film

"That's What Friends Are For" by Dionne & Friends spends the most time at the top of the US charts

ALF, the Oprah Winfrey Show, and Pee-wee's Playhouse premiere

I am still figuring out this LJ thing. It seems to be a little more involved than I had first thought. 
My life it seems is at a standstill. Waiting, Waiting, Waiting. The world seems to be holding it's breath. I am moving forward by inches. 
I guess I am "in a mood" (as my mother would say). They don't strike often, but when they do... They surprisingly seem to strike only after conversations with my ex/ best friend. (I know it was a bad combination.)
I am going to have to post up some of my short stories or something. Maybe that will cheer me up... 
Say- are there any other Lyonites out there?

Ok, ok, I am here now... It only took me a week or two to figure this thing out... The internet kept booting me out. :(
This is sort of a test message, to see if this thingie works.
